insolvent() - Method in interface question.Transactions
Returns true if the business is currently insolvent, i.e., if the cash reserve is negative.

inStock(Integer) - Method in class answer.WarehouseLedger
 
inStock() - Method in interface question.Ledger
Returns the number of items currently in stock as recorded in the ledger.
inStock(Integer) - Method in interface question.Ledger
Returns the number of items in stock at the end of the given day, or the current number in stock if parameter day is today.

J

jobDone() - Method in class answer.WarehouseTransactions
 
jobDone() - Method in interface question.Transactions
Returns true if the business simulation has ended because the number of days originally allocated for the job (when this class was constructed) has been exceeded.

L

Ledger - Interface in question
A ledger is a big book in which companies keep a record of their commercial transactions, typically one page per day.

N

O

orderUnfulfilled() - Method in class answer.WarehouseTransactions
 
orderUnfulfilled() - Method in interface question.Transactions
Returns true if the last order processed, using methods sellStock or restockAndSellStock, was not fulfilled, i.e., if more items were ordered than were in stock at the time.

Q

question - package question
 

R

restockAndSellStock(Integer) - Method in class answer.WarehouseTransactions
 
restockAndSellStock(Integer) - Method in interface question.Transactions
Complete a day's transactions by (1) restocking the warehouse to capacity, (2) selling the ordered number of items, and (3) by turning the page in the ledger, in that order.

sellStock(Integer) - Method in interface question.Transactions
Complete a day's transactions by (1) selling the ordered number of items, and (2) by turning the page in the ledger, in that order.

T

toString() - Method in class answer.WarehouseLedger
 
toString() - Method in interface question.Ledger
Returns a human-readable representation of the current state of the ledger.
Transactions - Interface in question
This interface defines the daily transactions associated with managing a buying-and-selling business, in this case a warehouse.

W

This class represents any exceptions generated by the warehouse simulation.

WarehouseLedger - Class in answer
A solution to the "warehouse ledger" part of INB370 Assignment 1.
WarehouseLedger(Integer, Integer, Integer, Integer, Integer) - Constructor for class answer.WarehouseLedger
Construct a warehouse's ledger with the supplied initial stock level and cash reserve.
WarehouseTransactions - Class in answer
A solution to the "warehouse transactions" part of INB370 Assignment 1.
WarehouseTransactions(Integer, Integer, WarehouseLedger) - Constructor for class answer.WarehouseTransactions
Define the transactions you can perform while managing a warehouse of items awaiting retail sale.
